thread.title: Mets manager says Matt Harvey won’t plunk any Dodgers
thread.title_full: Mets manager says Matt Harvey won’t plunk any Dodgers - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Mets manager says Matt Harvey won’t plunk any Dodgers
text:
Kathy Willens/AP Mets manager Terry Collins doesn’t want the Mets retaliating against Dodgers. Matt Harvey won't be plunking any Dodgers on Monday night, at least if Terry Collins has his way.
"I've had my conversation with Matt," the Mets manager said before Game 3 of the NLDS. "We're not throwing at anybody."
There are plenty of angry Mets fans after Chase Utley, whom Collins called "a thorn" in the team's side, slid into Ruben Tejada during Game 2.
Utley was suspended two games for the slide that broke Tejada’s leg, but he will be with Los Angeles during Game 3 as the appeals process plays out. However, he's not in the lineup.
"We can't let emotions take over," Collins said of Utley's appeal. "We have to play the game like we know how; we've got to let the past go."
Related Stories Chase Utley won't start against Matt Harvey, Mets in Game 3 Henrik Lundqvist pulling for Matt Harvey, Mets vs. Dodgers
